questions.question_text: What should an NSX administrator check to verify that VMware Identity Manager integration is successful?

choices.D: From the NSX UI the URI in the address bar must have “local=false” part of it.
choices.A: From the NSX UI the status of the VMware Identity Manager Integration must be “Enabled”.
choices.B: From the NSX CLI the status of the VMware Identity Manager Integration must be “Configured”.
choices.C: From VMware Identity Manager the status of the remote access application must be green.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
As in the official guide.

Selected Answer: ABC
D. Port DHCP per VNF: This is not a valid DHCP service in NSX. DHCP is not configured per VNF port.
E. VRF DHCP Server: NSX doesn't explicitly support a "VRF DHCP Server." While VRFs are supported for routing, DHCP services are associated with gateways or segments, not VRFs.

Selected Answer: ABC
Correct, as in the official 4.1.X vmware guide

Selected Answer: BCE
Mentioned in the official document

questions.question_text: Which three DHCP Services are supported by NSX? (Choose three.)
Which choice is a valid insertion point for North-South network introspection?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct, as in the official 4.1.X vmware guide

Selected Answer: C
C is the Answer. Need an Interface group for stateful services (including SNAT) on T-0 active-active gateway.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX/4.1/administration/GUID-37BE3A32-C4CA-4C31-80E0-7B8D2889D96A.html

choices.C: An Interface Group for the NSX Edge uplinks
choices.B: A Punting Traffic Group for the NSX Edge uplinks
choices.D: Tier-1 gateway in distributed only mode

questions.question_text: Which of the following settings must be configured in an NSX environment before enabling stateful active-active SNAT?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct, as in the official 4.1.X vmware guide

choices.B: Syslog is not configured on the NSX Manager.
choices.D: Distributed Firewall Rule logging is not enabled.
choices.A: Zero Trust Security is not enabled.
choices.C: Syslog is not configured on the ESXi transport node.

questions.question_text:
An NSX administrator is reviewing syslog and notices that Distributed Firewall Rules hit counts are not being logged.
What could cause this issue?
